verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto Aaron and to his sons, that they separate themselves from the holy things of the children of Israel, and that they profane not my holy name in those things which they hallow unto me: I am the LORD.
verses.ct: "Tell Aaron and his sons to treat the sacred offerings of the Israelites with respect and not dishonor my holy name through the things they set apart for me. I am the LORD.

verses.kjv: Say unto them, Whosoever he be of all your seed among your generations, that goeth unto the holy things, which the children of Israel hallow unto the LORD, having his uncleanness upon him, that soul shall be cut off from my presence: I am the LORD.
verses.ct: "Tell them: If any of your descendants in future generations approaches the sacred offerings that the Israelites set apart for the LORD while he is ceremonially unclean, that person must be removed from my presence. I am the LORD.

verses.kjv: What man soever of the seed of Aaron is a leper, or hath a running issue; he shall not eat of the holy things, until he be clean. And whoso toucheth any thing that is unclean by the dead, or a man whose seed goeth from him;
verses.ct: "No descendant of Aaron who has a skin disease or a bodily discharge may eat any of the sacred offerings until he is clean. This also applies to anyone who touches something made unclean by a dead body, or a man who has a seminal emission,

verses.kjv: Or whosoever toucheth any creeping thing, whereby he may be made unclean, or a man of whom he may take uncleanness, whatsoever uncleanness he hath;
verses.ct: or anyone who touches a swarming creature that makes him unclean, or who touches any person whose uncleanness can be transferred to him — whatever kind of uncleanness that person has.

verses.kjv: The soul which hath touched any such shall be unclean until even, and shall not eat of the holy things, unless he wash his flesh with water.
verses.ct: Anyone who touches any of these things will be unclean until evening and must not eat any of the sacred offerings unless he has washed his body with water.

verses.kjv: And when the sun is down, he shall be clean, and shall afterward eat of the holy things; because it is his food.
verses.ct: After the sun goes down, he will be clean again, and then he may eat from the sacred offerings, since that is his food.

verses.kjv: That which dieth of itself, or is torn with beasts, he shall not eat to defile himself therewith: I am the LORD.
verses.ct: He must not eat anything that died naturally or was killed by wild animals, because that would make him unclean. I am the LORD.

verses.kjv: They shall therefore keep mine ordinance, lest they bear sin for it, and die therefore, if they profane it: I the LORD do sanctify them.
verses.ct: The priests must follow my instructions carefully, or they will bring guilt on themselves and die for treating these things as common. I am the LORD who sets them apart as holy.

verses.kjv: There shall no stranger eat of the holy thing: a sojourner of the priest, or an hired servant, shall not eat of the holy thing.
verses.ct: No outsider may eat the sacred offerings. Neither a guest staying with a priest nor a hired worker may eat them.

verses.kjv: But if the priest buy any soul with his money, he shall eat of it, and he that is born in his house: they shall eat of his meat.
verses.ct: However, if a priest purchases a slave with his own money, that slave may eat from the offerings. Slaves born in his household may also eat his food.

verses.kjv: If the priest’s daughter also be married unto a stranger, she may not eat of an offering of the holy things.
verses.ct: If a priest's daughter marries someone who is not a priest, she may no longer eat from the sacred offerings.

verses.kjv: But if the priest’s daughter be a widow, or divorced, and have no child, and is returned unto her father’s house, as in her youth, she shall eat of her father’s meat: but there shall no stranger eat thereof.
verses.ct: But if a priest's daughter becomes widowed or divorced and has no children, and she returns to her father's household as she was in her youth, she may eat from her father's food. However, no outsider may eat any of it.

verses.kjv: And if a man eat of the holy thing unwittingly, then he shall put the fifth part thereof unto it, and shall give it unto the priest with the holy thing.
verses.ct: If someone accidentally eats a sacred offering, he must repay its value plus an additional 20 percent and give it to the priest along with the sacred offering.

verses.kjv: And they shall not profane the holy things of the children of Israel, which they offer unto the LORD;
verses.ct: The priests must not allow the sacred offerings that the Israelites present to the LORD to be treated as common,

verses.kjv: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.
verses.ct: or let people bring guilt on themselves by eating the sacred offerings. I am the LORD who sets these offerings apart as holy."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto Aaron, and to his sons, and unto all the children of Israel, and say unto them, Whatsoever he be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers in Israel, that will offer his oblation for all his vows, and for all his freewill offerings, which they will offer unto the LORD for a burnt offering;
verses.ct: "Speak to Aaron, his sons, and all the Israelites, and tell them: When anyone from the house of Israel, or any foreigner living in Israel, presents a burnt offering to the LORD — whether to fulfill a vow or as a voluntary offering —

verses.kjv: Ye shall offer at your own will a male without blemish, of the beeves, of the sheep, or of the goats.
verses.ct: it must be a male animal without any defect, taken from the cattle, sheep, or goats, so that it will be accepted.

verses.kjv: But whatsoever hath a blemish, that shall ye not offer: for it shall not be acceptable for you.
verses.ct: Do not bring anything that has a defect, because it will not be accepted on your behalf.

verses.kjv: And whosoever offereth a sacrifice of peace offerings unto the LORD to accomplish his vow, or a freewill offering in beeves or sheep, it shall be perfect to be accepted; there shall be no blemish therein.
verses.ct: When anyone brings a peace offering to the LORD to fulfill a vow or as a voluntary offering, whether from the herd or the flock, the animal must be completely free of defects in order to be accepted.

verses.kjv: Blind, or broken, or maimed, or having a wen, or scurvy, or scabbed, ye shall not offer these unto the LORD, nor make an offering by fire of them upon the altar unto the LORD.
verses.ct: Do not present to the LORD any animal that is blind, injured, crippled, or that has sores, a rash, or scabs. Do not place any such animal on the altar as a fire offering to the LORD.

verses.kjv: Either a bullock or a lamb that hath any thing superfluous or lacking in his parts, that mayest thou offer for a freewill offering; but for a vow it shall not be accepted.
verses.ct: You may present a bull or a lamb that has a limb too long or too short as a voluntary offering, but it will not be accepted to fulfill a vow.

verses.kjv: Ye shall not offer unto the LORD that which is bruised, or crushed, or broken, or cut; neither shall ye make any offering thereof in your land.
verses.ct: Do not present to the LORD any animal whose testicles are bruised, crushed, torn, or cut. You must not do this anywhere in your land.

verses.kjv: Neither from a stranger’s hand shall ye offer the bread of your God of any of these; because their corruption is in them, and blemishes be in them: they shall not be accepted for you.
verses.ct: You must not accept such animals from a foreigner and offer them as food for your God either. Since they are damaged and defective, they will not be accepted on your behalf."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: When a bullock, or a sheep, or a goat, is brought forth, then it shall be seven days under the dam; and from the eighth day and thenceforth it shall be accepted for an offering made by fire unto the LORD.
verses.ct: "When a calf, lamb, or young goat is born, it must stay with its mother for 7 days. From the 8th day onward, it will be acceptable as a fire offering to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And whether it be cow or ewe, ye shall not kill it and her young both in one day.
verses.ct: Do not slaughter a cow or a ewe and its young on the same day.

verses.kjv: And when ye will offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving unto the LORD, offer it at your own will.
verses.ct: When you offer a thanksgiving sacrifice to the LORD, offer it in a way that will be accepted.

verses.kjv: On the same day it shall be eaten up; ye shall leave none of it until the morrow: I am the LORD.
verses.ct: It must be eaten that same day; do not leave any of it until the next morning. I am the LORD.

verses.kjv: Therefore shall ye keep my commandments, and do them: I am the LORD.
verses.ct: You must keep my commands and follow them. I am the LORD.

verses.kjv: Neither shall ye profane my holy name; but I will be hallowed among the children of Israel: I am the LORD which hallow you,
verses.ct: Do not dishonor my holy name. I must be treated as holy among the Israelites. I am the LORD who sets you apart as holy,

verses.kjv: That brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: I am the LORD.
verses.ct: the one who brought you out of the land of Egypt to be your God. I am the LORD."
